result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Thome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua D Thome is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua D Thome was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Report clean and sober
Huber granted
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Bond to be applied to fines/costs
Payment Plan: $50.00/month commencing on June 1, 2017

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D Thome

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Joshua D Thome in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Zamzow agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before April 28, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $100.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Credit = 5 days
Bond to be applied
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on June , 2017

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 2, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua D Thome in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided.  Atty Zamzow states that she did speak with the defendant regarding the offer; parties are close to resolution and asks for a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Return date on January 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer has been provided.  Atty Zamzow asks for another return so she has time to speak with her client.  Atty Zamzow will get a new authorization.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on December 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Joshua D Thome in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zamzow states that she was recently appointed and has not had any time to get Discovery; requests a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Return date on October 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Joshua D Thome in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided; in speaking with the defendant before court there is not a resolution at this time.
Defendant agrees.
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant is trying to avoid jail time.  Defendant would like to get an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Return date on August 18, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on July 12, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Return date on August 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial

Defendant Joshua D Thome in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
Court confirms defendant's address.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold.    Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance  Return date scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 10:45 am.
